result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Anthony Steven Martinez

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Anthony Steven Martinez not in court, in custody.  Attorney Colleen A Taylor in court for Anthony Steven Martinez.  Attorney Mallory R Davis in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Scheduling conference held. Defense requests Final Pretrial and Jury Trial dates. Any witness lists, special jury instructions, and motion in limine to be filed 48 hours before the final pretrial date. Court orders case adjourned for final pretrial and jury trial in Branch 29.
Final pre-trial scheduled for November 21, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Jury trial scheduled for December 12, 2022 at 08:30 am.

CASE HEARD IN PRELIM FOR BR. 29:
Defendant Anthony Steven Martinez appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Colleen A Taylor appeared by video for Anthony Steven Martinez.  Prosecuting attorney Thomas Hasle in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the State: MPD Officer D. Mendez-Santiago. State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 29.
Scheduling conference scheduled for October 26, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Anthony Steven Martinez not in court, in custody.  Attorney Colleen A Taylor appeared by video for Anthony Steven Martinez.  Attorney Mallory R Davis appeared by video for State of Wisconsin.
Status conference held. Defense counsel was recently appointed and requests a preliminary hearing. Court finds CAUSE to adjourn the preliminary hearing. Case is adjourned to Br. 29.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for October 11, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Anthony Steven Martinez not in court, in custody.  Attorney Mallory R Davis in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Case set for a State v Lee hearing. The PD's Office needs additional time to appoint counsel. Court finds CAUSE to adjourn the preliminary hearing. Court orders matter adjourned for a status of counsel hearing in Branch 29.
Status conference scheduled for September 30, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Anthony Steven Martinez not in court, in custody in HOC.  Prosecuting attorney Arthur Kenneth Thexton in court in person for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case set for a preliminary hearing. State's witness is present. SPD has not appointed counsel. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE to the trial court for a State V. Lee Hearing.
Hearing scheduled for September 8, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Received and Filed. Appointment Status Letter

Defendant Anthony Steven Martinez not in court, defendant in custody.  Arthur Kenneth Thexton appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case set for a preliminary hearing. States witness is not present. SPD has not appointed counsel. States requests that the matter be set for a State V. Lee hearing; denied. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for September 1, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Court ordered no contact with NM (DOB 8/7/07); VNM (DOB 12/17/76).
No Contact/No Weapons Order, signed and filed.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for Level 5 Supervision with Electronic Monitoring; No Contact order. If an Electronic Monitoring Device (GPS) is unavailable and Cash Bail has been paid, Defendant to be released and placed on the Electronic Monitoring (GPS) waiting list. ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY/DEFENDANT to be monitored by drug testing and portable breathalyzers.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant Anthony Steven Martinez in court with attorney Heather L. Johnson.  Defendant Anthony Steven Martinez in custody.  Arthur Kenneth Thexton appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Anthony Steven Martinez appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Kiefer Branch 29.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch PE for branch 29.  This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea  Preliminary hearing scheduled for August 9, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
